entry.title: Always optimize symbolization.
entry.content:

always use optimizations; otherwise, tests may end up timing out in

debug builds.

entry.title: Shared Storage: Save expected histogram sample counts from perf tests
entry.content:
We calculate and save the expected sample counts for the shared

storage specific histograms for the current benchmark run in a file

in the data directory (ignored by the newly added .gitignore). This

will enable the post-processing script (to be added in a followup) to

check whether the actual sample counts are equal to the expected

counts.



We also save the artifacts directory for the current run in a file in

the data directory for the post-processing script to read. This script

will be added in https://crrev.com/c/5321541.



Bug: 1516507,1218540

entry.title: Support preferred platform for cross app web attribution in browser
entry.content:
The Attribution-Reporting-Info header data is untrusted and needs to be

parsed by DataDecoder. This CL introduces a queue to hold all pending

registration data to ensure the order of registrations in the same

redirect chain.



The Attribution-Reporting-Info header will be parsed first

asynchronously, the preferred platform parsed from the header will be

used to decide which header to parse asynchronously, either the web or

OS header.



This CL also adds a virtual test suite to run devtools-related WPTs with

in browser migration enabled. The fetch requests in those tests are

changed to keepalive so that they're handled in the browser for code

coverage.



Bug: 325103501

Change-Id: If11880d2ae3eb42ed948d7ce3605ccc5f25882f6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300820

Reviewed-by: Alex Rudenko

Commit-Queue: Nan Lin

entry.title: Allow using POSIX_FADV_SEQUENTIAL in base::PreReadFile()
entry.content:
For some uses cases, POSIX_FADV_SEQUENTIAL is substantially faster than

POSIX_FADV_WILLNEED. This change adds an option to base::PreReadFile()

to hint at sequential file reading. This was not added as the default

since it looks like other callers may not be doing sequential reads

(e.g. database files).



Bug: 326240401

entry.title: Add interesttarget attribute
entry.content:
This adds support for the experimental `interesttarget` attribute, as

specified in the open-ui "Interest Invokers" explainer.



(https://open-ui.org/components/interest-invokers.explainer/)



The `interesttarget` attribute maps to the IDL `interestTargetElement`,

similar to `invokeTargetElement`.



This attribute currently has no behaviour changes associated with it,

that will be handled in follow-ups.

entry.title: Shared Storage: Slightly reorganize perf tests to prepare to add script
entry.content:
In order to prepare to add a script to post-process results of the

shared storage perf tests, we (1) add a .gitignore so that the data

subdirectory that the script will use won't be added to the repo;

(2) add a new utils submodule which will house

post-processing-related code, so that it can be accessed by a

future vpython executable, but any necessary functions can also be

called by the benchmark code itself; and (3) move the list of

shared storage histograms to be measured to a separate file, so the

list can be accessed by both shared_storage.py and the new utils

submodule.



A followup (https://crrev.com/c/5321541) will add the

post-processing script calling the code to be added in utils/ which

will create and use the data directory.



Bug: 1516507,1218540

Change-Id: I2617d00663cba4e0c24b83315d839368bcec2141

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319061

entry.title: Fix occlusion order and raster scale update order in overview
entry.content:
In overview mode, we want to make sure occlusion state updates and

raster scale updates are properly ordered. In particular, on overview

enter, we want to make sure that raster scale updates occur before

occlusion state updates. This is because we don't want to raster

something at its full scale that was previously evicted. If the raster

scale update comes first, it can be ignored for hidden windows until

they are marked as visible. Similarly, we want to make sure raster scale

updates come after occlusion updates on exiting overview mode, so things

that were rastered at a lower scale and are hidden outside of overview

mode do not get re-rastered to their full scale before being marked as

hidden.



Since OverviewController has a timeout where it pauses occlusion on exit

for a while, we also pause raster scale updates to make sure they happen

after occlusion updates.



This is particularly useful if there are a lot of evicted lacros windows

and overview mode is entered (or exited). This CL makes sure that those

evicted lacros windows are rastered at a lower scale without being first

rastered at a higher scale (which would happen if they were first marked

as visible via the occlusion tracker).



Bug: 1278648

Test: CQ + local testing

Change-Id: I850501f8e0a9b7bc63bd5a70039530c58ca183e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5273987

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in PersistentAvailabilityStoreTest
entry.content:
This test class creates a test proto database, via CreateDB, that then

has its unique_ptr passed into a call to PersistentAvailabilityStore's

LoadAndUpdateStore. That test database is owned only by the callstack

into LoadAndUpdateStore.



A pointer to that same test proto database is cached on the test class,

as db_, to facilitate running the test, triggering associated callbacks,

etc. But, since the test class does not own the test database, there are

several different ways in which that cached pointer can end up pointing

at freed memory as the LoadAndUpdateStore operation completes, either

successfully or fails due to error conditions simulated via the tests,

and unwinds the stack.



This change clears the cached pointer when the load callback gets

called. This callback is only called once per LoadAndUpdateStore call,

irrespective of success/failure, just before the callstack unwinds and

frees the test proto database.



Change-Id: I0b3d69c059ad6379572b6b1e51a8c318b624fd36

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5325571

entry.title: WebUI: Detect hidden .d.ts file dependencies in ts_library()
entry.content:
In some cases, developers use ts_library() path_mappings to map URL

prefixes to src/ directories containing TypeScript definitions files.

However, any files imported using these mappings are not actually added

to |inputs| for gn, unless they are also listed in the ts_library()

project's |definitions| argument. This leads to compile failures in

remote execution environments, and to gn not correctly re-building

targets when .d.ts files they depend on are modified.



This CL uses TS compiler's listFilesOnly option to output all files

encountered when building a target, and then checks that any .d.ts files

in the list that are not in a generated directory are correctly listed

in |definitions|. It throws an error asking the developer to add such

files to |definitions| if any missing .d.ts files are found.



Started by dpapad@ at:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5321764



Bug: 326005022

Change-Id: I33bcad71b9ebf564e032a8e7d582a432a1178421

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328868

entry.title: webauthn: atomically commit state updates.
entry.content:
Now that the `StateMachine` can be canceled (when the primary account

changes), it may have left partial updates to the local state. These

changes won't be written out because `WriteState` wasn't called, but a

future `StateMachine` invocation may trigger a write for a different

user, which would then write out the partial state for the user that

signed out.



Thus pass a copy of the state to the `StateMachine` and only update the

main copy (and disk) when the `StateMachine` explicitly calls

`WriteState`.

entry.title: [views_ax] Migrated the ui/views path from OverrideName to SetName
entry.content:
This CL migrates files in the ui/views path to use the new attribute

setters in ViewAccessibility rather than the Override methods.



This is a continuation of CL:5309768 which is part of a project

to transition the querying of accessible data from a "pull" system

to a "push" system.



There are no behavior changes, but we removed the default parameter

of kAttribute for the NameFrom. Views authors should supply the

NameFrom parameter with the relevant one for their use case, instead

of relying on a default kAttribute which might not be correct for

many use cases. Views authors should refer to the comment for

ViewAccessibility::SetName in view_accessibility.h for a quick

guide on which NameFrom attribute to use.



Bug: 325137417

entry.title: Revert "desk_profiles: Do not restore to the previous desk for new browser"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 1925bdc0c1bf8cd6ecd595a30333cbc946cbbadf.



Reason for revert: The change breaks the virtual desk aspect of "continue where you left off" in that all browser windows are restored to the current desk rather than whatever desk they were on. For now we will revert this change.



Original change's description:

> desk_profiles: Do not restore to the previous desk for new browser

>

> With Desk Profiles feature, chromeos can now associate a lacros profile

> with a virtual desk. When launching a new browser within the desk, a

> browser for that profile will be launched. With session restore, it

> restores the new browser window to its previous desk.

>

> This CL proposes that when lacros and Desk Profiles are both enabled,

> the new browser window should *not* be restored to its previous desk.

>

> Quick demo can be found at - b/319730718.

>

> Bug: b/319730718

> Test: manual

entry.title: webnn: switch coreml model format to MIL.Program
entry.content:
Switch from NeuralNetwork message type to MILSpec::Program type

according to guidance from Apple engineers. The new format allows better

control of data precisions, the intermediate outputs have data types

specified and CoreML will use these to determine which compute units

to execute.



Right now this creates the simplest hierarchy with a single Program,

Function, Block, and a list of ops, which can be expanded upon based

on new use cases.

entry.title: [anchor] Persist anchor query results on Element
entry.content:
When doing interleaved style recalcs from out-of-flow layout,

we're able to evaluate anchor()/anchor-size() queries against

the AnchorEvaluator(Impl) owned by layout. However, anchor queries

also need *some* answer for non-interleaved style recalcs:

currently they happen without any AnchorEvaluator, and therefore

any query will use the fallback value. This is not ideal

for performance, because any non-interleaved style recalc is very

likely to set layout dirty, only for layout to come back later

and restore the value we previously had.



Therefore, this CL implements a way for the last seen anchor query

results to "stick", until the next out-of-flow-interleaved

style recalc takes place. This is done by implementing no less

than *two* new AnchorEvaluators:



1. AnchorResults, which "evaluates" queries by looking up

the result in a map.

2. ResultCachingAnchorEvaluator, which forwards queries to

the layout-provided evaluator, but also stores the results

into an AnchorResults object for future use.



This feature is still behind a disabled runtime flag, due to

a blocking crash bug (crbug.com/324930388).

Interleaving anchor queries (crbug.com/41483417) is otherwise

complete as of this CL.



Bug: 41483417

Change-Id: Ibf5a7f43336e8d1d9b827eab05087fd003d4b379

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5321522

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Commit-Queue: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266159}

entry.title: QR code: Paint quiet zone underneath `//components/qr_code_generator`.
entry.content:
This CL moves painting of the "quiet zone" from

`//chrome/browser/ui/views/qrcode_generator/qrcode_generator_bubble.cc`

into `//components/qr_code_generator/bitmap_generator.cc`. This helps

to ensure that all clients of `qr_code_generator` make an explicit

decision about who is responsible for generating the quiet zone.



The CL tweaks the code underneath `//components/qr_code_generator`

instead of reusing/copying the code from `qrcode_generator_bubble.cc`.

This results in a somewhat simpler code, and avoids creating additional

images (and additional memory copies). The end-to-end behavior of

`qrcode_generator_bubble.cc` shouldn't change - it should include the

exact same quiet zone before and after this CL (except for the colors -

see the next paragraph).



The old code would use

`GetColorProvider()->GetColor(kColorQrCodeBackground)` as the color of

the "quiet zone". The new code always uses white. The new behavior is

desirable because the quiet zone should have the same color as the

light-colored QR pixels (and currently `bitmap_generator.cc` always

paints black pixels on white background). In the future we may want to

make the exact colors configurable (e.g. theme-based).



Other than the color change described above, the CL should preserve the

old behavior (using `kWillBeAddedByClient` everywhere except the pixel

tests and `qrcode_generator_bubble.cc`). In particular, after this CL

most QR code clients continue to not include the quiet zone within the

image of the QR code (although surrounding UI elements may accidentally

provide such quiet zone).



Manual tests:

* Manually navigated to https://example.com and

used Chrome menu => Save and share => Create QR Code and

verified that the generated code works with Google Lens on an Android

device

* Manually tested whether the new pixel test goldens decode successfully

with Google Lens on an Android device (see

https://crbug.com/325664342#comment6 and #comment8 and #comment9):

- `DinoWithRoundQrPixelsAndLocators`,

`PassKeyWithSquareQrPixelsAndLocators`, and `BigUrl` tests worked

fine after this CL (an improvement, because their goldens didn't

decode before this CL)

- `HugeUrl` test didn't decode before and after this CL



Bug: 325664342

entry.title: Shared Storage: Migrate database to remove length column
entry.content:
Now that we no longer base our capacity check on the number of entries

that an origin has stored, we don't need to track this quantity in a

column--it can be computed on the fly if the `length()` method is

called. So we remove the unnecessary `length` column from the

`SharedStorageDatabase`'s sql table `per_origin_mapping`.

entry.title: [Grid] Reuse a subgrid's MinMaxSizes cache whenever possible
entry.content:
1. Removing the concept of only reusing the `MinMaxSizes` cache of a

subgrid within the same step of the grid sizing algorithm in favor

of reusing it in the second pass or within different runs of the

`ComputeMinMaxSizes` and `Layout` methods if possible.



2. To determine whether we can reuse the cache or not we rely on the new

`IsSubgridMinMaxSizesCacheDirty` flag in `LayoutObject`, but this

change introduces more logic that determines if the cache must be

invalidated depending on whether a subgrid's subgridded tracks

changed between calls to compute its intrinsic sizes.



3. This change shouldn't have any behavioral impact.



Significant perf deltas:

- nested-subgrid

avg 260.401 runs/s -> 286.556 runs/s (10% better)



Bug: 1505606

Change-Id: Id2cee4d5b412867f3002ae2f532fa7ebe1857d9f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5230717

entry.title: Shared Storage: Consolidate perf test html files and pass size instead
entry.content:
We replace the four previously used test html files for the shared

storage perf tests with a single html file who embedding script parses

a query param `size` in order to determine how many entries to put in

the initial database.



We also add a TODO to change the size of the large benchmark from 9000

to 10000 once the removal of the previous 10000-entry limit hits

stable.



We then expose the size associated with each benchmark to the story

and story set classes for shared storage, in preparation for a

followup.



The followup (https://crrev.com/c/5321541) will add the ability for

the tests to calculate how many histogram samples are expected to be

recorded, along with a script to check if the sample count

expectations were met.



Bug: 1516507,1218540

Change-Id: I003562f8986c2c041d8f321c7cf7db093eefa57d

entry.title: [Chromecast] BufferWrapper uses base class' size_
entry.content:
BufferWrapper::size_ is added to track the size of `base_`, when

IOBuffer doesn't have a `size_` variable. Now IOBuffer has its own

`size_` so BufferWrapper should use its base class' variable.

entry.title: immersive fullscreen: fix tab drag window size
entry.content:
In immersive fullscreen when dragging a tab the window size of the new

browser window is an odd shape, short and wide. The tab strip is hosted

in a separate widget and that widget was being used as the template for

the new browser window size.



To fix this use the top level widget to ensure the browser window is

used as the template.



Bug: 326514282

entry.title: Use different focus indicator styles for Picker grid and list items.
entry.content:
Grid items indicate focus using a rounded rectangular ring around the

item.



List items indicate focus using a vertical bar with half rounded corners

at the left edge of the item.



As drive by, remove `SetPaintToLayer` from PickerItemView since

SetMasksToBounds(true) was incorrectly clipping the focus ring, and it

doesn't seem like PickerItemViews need to paint to layer.

entry.title: [bookmarks] Change default folder logic for account bookmarks
entry.content:
When account bookmarks are active, the default folders should be the

corresponding account folders (e.g. mobile_node should be

account_mobile_node). In addition, the last used parent should be

cleared when signing in/out so that the proper default folder can be

used.

entry.title: Disable Real Webcam tests on Linux OS.
entry.content:
Using and maintaining physical machines to run tests is costly and time consuming for the WebRTC infra team. There have been an effort to reduce the number of physical machines with b/312914606 and https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/bot?id=lin-185-e505 is one of the last machine remaining.



This machine is used to run 4 tests on Linux against a real Webcam.

Note that these tests are also implemented using fake Webcams here:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/capture/video/fake_video_capture_device_unittest.cc.

And they also run on Chrome OS using a webcam service.

entry.title: Enable VRR independently per display
entry.content:
This change allows VRR to be enabled or disabled for each display. Prior

to this change, VRR would be set for all capable displays. After this

change, VRR can be controlled via the DisplayConfigurator independently

for each display.



This change also updates the VRR decision logic to leverage the new

method of control. Prior to this change, when GameMode was active, VRR

would be enabled across all capable displays. After this change, when

GameMode is active, VRR is only enabled for the display containing the

current gaming session.



Bug: 309969845

Change-Id: I2a9b57e6410e5f5d3b45818cc60da435882f044a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5258628

Commit-Queue: Andrew Wolfers

Reviewed-by: Drew Davenport

entry.title: Fix memory leak with VideoFrameConverter.
entry.content:
VFC uses FrameBufferPool to provide thread safe scratch space for

conversions, but FBP has weird usage. In addition to the concept

of being held by a VideoFrame, buffers also have the concept of

being held by a library. This is needed by libvpx and ffmpeg, but

is a foot gun in other circumstances.



The fix is to call ReleaseFrameBuffer() immediately in our case

since there is no library also trying to hold on to our frame

buffer. A test is added to ensure the pool doesn't grow.



R=sandersd



Fixed: 326904528

Change-Id: I9124262bb9c38d7e3a00bb568fd057d3321f7148

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328768

entry.title: TaskAttribution: Move ownership of the tracker to V8PerIsolateData
entry.content:
Continuation preserved embedder data, which is managed by

TaskAttributionTracker, is now tracked per isolate. This CL moves

ownership of TaskAttributionTracker from ThreadScheduler to

V8PerIsolateData, which

- aligns with how CPED is managed

- slightly optimizes getting CPED (avoids TLS access in

ThreadScheduler::Current())

- provides better separation for MBI



This is mostly mechanical:

- ThreadScheduler::Current()->GetTaskAttributionTracker -->

scheduler::TaskAttributionTracker::From(isolate)

- RunningTask(isolate) --> RunningTask()



Main non-mechanical changes:

- Introduce TaskAttributionTracker::From as a helper to get the

tracker from per-isolate data

- Register a TaskAttributionImpl factory method with V8PerIsolateData

in modules_initializer.cc; use that to create the tracker.

Note: this is done to get around layering issues (the tracker is

implemented in modules).



Bug: 1351643

Change-Id: Ic6fbea8f8be040442e7cad2f2a1c601420c50509

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5078913

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

entry.title: In a few cases, check whether calc() values have percents rather than assuming they do.
entry.content:
This starts the path of treating calc() values that don't have percent

values within them (but instead have intrinsic sizes in them) as not

having percents.



This gets height: calc-size() working in a few useful cases.



This adds tests for height animation. Of the four sets of tests, only

the second set currently passes. The last two sets require further work

on correctly propagating whether a value has percentages through

animations. The first set requires implementing support for 'auto'

values in 'calc-size()'.



This also adds tests for static values of height. These all pass except

for the tests that depend on percentages resolving to zero in the cases

where the value was not treated as being a percentage value.



Bug: 313072

Change-Id: Iecf12450ac7df0c7c347a50f0f3664ae388cbfae

entry.title: immersive fullscreen: fix infobar missing clicks
entry.content:
When the toolbar is hidden and the infobar is present, the overlay

window is placed in an unexpected location causing clicks to be missed.



After the remote cocoa immersive controller hides the overlay window,

the Views controller (responding to a browser layout) changes the

origin of the overlay window. We really only want the views controller

to change the size, not the origin.



This CL stops Views from driving the overlay window movement, allowing

the remote cocoa immersive controller to move the window as expected.



Bug: 326895880

Change-Id: I1a4c20a31070a51b41f56bac0fa370ef8329310b

entry.title: media/video/picture: fix service_texture_id_ initialization
entry.content:
This adds zero-initializaton of PictureBuffer::service_texture_id_. This

member variable was added to replace an std::vector in a recent commit:

https://crrev.com/c/5274058. This change had the side effect of leaving

the variable (which used to have a default constructor) uninitialized.



This caused a problem with ChromeOS VDA tests that use the

PictureBuffer(int32_t id, const gfx::Size& size) constructor.

Initializing the value to zero lets the tests pass and seems

semantically correct based on comments in the PictureBufferManager.

entry.title: Revert "Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect"
entry.content:
This reverts commit c6ebc3f815d64748a9eabd3a4fb05afb91f6b8d9.



Reason for revert: only suspect for build breakage, see https://crbug.com/327241558



Original change's description:

> Android: Use assert_no_deps to ensure java and native trees do not connect

>

> Our java and native build graphs are meant to be independent, but

> sometimes deps are added between them. The deps do not do anything, but

> slow down builds by reducing parallelism. These checks should prevent

> such deps from being introduced.

>

> To achieve this parallelism, adds an "asset_deps" field to android_apk

> and android_bundle_module targets that enable adding deps directly to

> the "package_apk" step. This was needed for

> libchrome_unwind_table_assets and loadable_modules.

>

> Bug: 325619950

> Change-Id: I36c8cd3757650249e3d544310208825882dcad4d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301510

entry.title: Move WebDataServiceFactory into subdirectory
entry.content:
web_data_service_factory.(cc|h) is responsible for creating the

WebDataServiceWrapper, defined in components/webdata_services/.

The factory is contained in chrome/browser, rather than a

webdata_services subdirectory, like the components/ counterpart.



This CL moves the files into a subdirectory and gives ownership to

components/webdata_services/OWNERS. A DIR_METADATA file matching

components/webdata_services/DIR_METADATA is created as well.



Renaming was done using

git mv chrome/browser/web_data_service_factory.*

chrome/browser/webdata_services/

./tools/git/mass-rename.py

git cl format



The include_rules from chrome/browser/DEPS can likely be simplified now,

but this is not attempted by this CL.



Bug: b/322147254

Change-Id: Icb6e41be1c4314ad062550f74b2958f2dad3a1c2
